posts.post_content:
Nice art, horrible card.  
Take [sun droplet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=sun droplet) and [farsight mask](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=farsight mask), put them on a pile, bang on them with a hammer until they stop doing their job and you end up with this.  
  
Sun droplet costs 2 mana instead of 5, requires then no more activation costs, and gives you your life back far quicker and twice as efficient as this card.  
  
Farsight mask, while just an average card by itself, at least draws you a card for each creature dealing damage to you, having the change to draw you far more cards than this (and also requires no more activation costs).  
  
This this is just too slow, clunky, ineffective and expensive.
posts.html:

Take sun droplet and farsight mask, put them on a pile, bang on them with a hammer until they stop doing their job and you end up with this.

Sun droplet costs 2 mana instead of 5, requires then no more activation costs, and gives you your life back far quicker and twice as efficient as this card.

Farsight mask, while just an average card by itself, at least draws you a card for each creature dealing damage to you, having the change to draw you far more cards than this (and also requires no more activation costs).

This this is just too slow, clunky, ineffective and expensive.

posts.post_content: Beautiful art and flavor text, but I don't like it. You pay five mana and wait to be damaged for the opportunity to spend two *more* mana to gain two life and a card. [Survival Cache](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Survival Cache) is so much better than this it's not even funny. 2.5/5

Posted By: Ameisenber (4/17/2010 2:06:30 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Nice, but not 5 mana nice. It would be great in suicide black if it were cheaper and if it counted losing life as well as damage. Take 2 off the cost, add that in and remove the lifegain and it'd be a cool draw engine. As is it pretty much serves to help a suicide black deck last a little bit more into the midgame, but I'd rather play a card that made sure the game never went that long.
posts.html:
